title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 April 2016 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has quit  
01:23 <abusenius> has quit  
01:49 <lkrejci> has quit  
06:51 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
07:15 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:45 <woshilapin> has quit  
08:06 <cjd> has quit  
08:15 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <martinus\_\_> boubou, what's the issue exactly ?  
08:37 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <mflorea> has quit  
09:01 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
09:02 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <vmassol> Enygma`: good morning, just finished a BFD I started yesterday, hope it counts! :)  
09:20 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <vmassol> actually 2 ;)  
09:24 <acotiuga> seems that it counts :)  
09:24 <acotiuga> hello!  
09:24 <vmassol> hi alex  
09:25 <acotiuga> AND resolved >= "2016/03/30" AND resolved <= "2016/04/01 23:59"  this means today still counts :D  
09:26 <vmassol> cool  
09:26 <vmassol> (it shouldn't normally but we do this to allow for timeframes)  
09:26 <vmassol> s/timeframes/timezones  
09:26 <acotiuga> am I still allowed to label some bugfixes?  
09:27 <acotiuga> to be fair, not :)  
09:27 <vmassol> if it's bugs you started yesterdayand you're finishing now sure  
09:27 <vmassol> otherwise, no  
09:28 <cjd> gm folks  
09:28 <cjd> I just noticed that in CKEditor I don't have the window at the top to change the title, is this intended ?  
09:29 <vmassol> hi cjd  
09:29 <cjd> Also I notice that CKEditor extension is maturing nicely :)  
09:29 <vmassol> indeed that's a bug cjd  
09:29 <cjd> Do you need a report or is this all set  
09:29 <cjd> ?  
09:29 <vmassol> I have no idea, better report it just in case  
09:30 <cjd> ok  
09:30 <vmassol> mflorea1: ?  
09:31 <mflorea1> cjd: go ahead and report it  
09:31 <cjd> ok  
09:31 <vmassol> I'm just testing ckeditor a bit too and there are very nice things  
09:31 <vmassol> I like the ability to move a macro around  
09:31 <vmassol> with drag and drop  
09:31 <vmassol> no idea if it's useful but it's fancy ;)  
09:31 <cjd> Yes, that's one which is breaking our Realtime WYSIWYG :)  
09:32 <cjd> we have an issue opened for that  
09:32 <vmassol> hehe  
09:32 <cjd> It causes the macro to turn into text  
09:33 <cjd> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/CKEDITOR-54  
09:33 <mflorea1> thanks  
09:34 <cjd> Did you make any progress on the strike/underline issue ?  
09:39 <cjd> Oh interesting, I created a document with an empty title and an H1 header at the top and then I looked at the title and the title is the name of the document  
09:39 <cjd> so at some point I guess we yanked that "fish around in the content looking for a header and use that for the title" thing from getTitle() ?  
09:40 <cjd> I suppose that was a killer for performance so maybe tmortagne removed it..  
09:40 <vmassol> yes  
09:40 <vmassol> there's a compat flag to turn it back on  
09:40 <vmassol> that was several years ago  
09:40 <cjd> heh  
09:40 <cjd> +1 remove it, it's magical and bad for perf  
09:40 <cjd> and I remember the code for handling it, esp. w/ syntax 1 was awful  
09:40 <vmassol> # xwiki.title.compatibility=1  
09:41 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9971  
09:41 <vmassol> indeed labelled as performance  
09:41 <cjd> Yeah, I have a vague memory of some profiling results coming back and getTitle() was quite a killer  
09:42 <vmassol> so several years ago is a bit exagerated ;) just one year  
09:43 <vmassol> one year+  
09:43 <tmortagne> is was disabled several years ago and enabled back one release later for "retro compatibility reason"  
09:43 <tmortagne> and then finally disabled again  
09:43 <vmassol> ah that's why I had the memory of several years  
09:52 <vmassol> tmortagne: any idea how to get rig of a local modificaiton that doesn't want to go away because of case  
09:52 <vmassol> git reset --hard origin/master  
09:52 <vmassol> doesn't work  
09:52 <vmassol> it's  ../xwiki-rendering-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/block/ListBLock.java  
09:53 <tmortagne> vmassol: well I don't understand why you have case issue anywhere else than Windows to begin with :)  
09:53 <vmassol> hehe  
09:54 <vmassol> "t is because the osx file system is case preserving andcase insensitive by default."  
09:54 <vmassol> I'll try a git mv and then discard  
09:54 <vmassol> doesn't work  
09:54 <cjd> oh yeah, I flipped my mac to case sensitive just so I wouldn't have Weird Issues  
09:55 <vmassol> ok I'll remove my whole ws  
09:55 <tmortagne> sorry don't have much experience with this kind of issue :)  
09:55 <vmassol> I asked yu becauase I remember you knew a trick once  
09:56 <tmortagne> a trick I never used then or it was someone else  
09:56 <vmassol> anyway done  
09:56 <vmassol> argh  
09:56 <vmassol> problem is still there  
09:56 <vmassol> ok I'll need to google more  
09:56 <tmortagne> what is the issue exactly ?  
09:57 <vmassol> https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/93c54def7b0c62980afe0de5d5c5e25c/raw/fa60fafdb22dc10bc1f8c316f6107d9b00ad81a0/gistfile1.txt  
09:58 <tmortagne> hmm makes me think that the ListBLock vs ListBlock thing probably makes impossible to git pull on windows and I'm surpised you could if you have case insensitive FS  
09:58 <tmortagne> do you have two files or only one ?  
09:59 <tmortagne> it's probably impossible to fix your issue if you have only one file  
09:59 <tmortagne> we'll probably have to either revert of find another name for the new class  
10:01 <vmassol> I have only ListBLock.java  
10:02 <vmassol> I could wipe out my HD and reformat it differently but I'd rather not do that ;)  
10:02 <tmortagne> reopened XRENDERING-438  
10:02 <tmortagne> and nobody can do that on Windows anyway so we need to fix it  
10:02 <vmassol> trying somrthing  
10:02 <tmortagne> but you should probably still do it at some point ;)  
10:04 <vmassol> no dice  
10:05 <tmortagne> not sure what name to choose instead of ListBlock...  
10:07 <cjd> It doesn't work to `git clone` fresh and then just never checkout old versions ?  
10:12 <vmassol> git clone doesn't work  
10:12 <vmassol> see my paste above  
10:12 <tmortagne> cjd: at best you have a missing file so no it doe snot work  
10:17 <cjd> ouch  
10:17 <vmassol> right now I cannot merge the fix I did on master this morning to the 7.4.x branch  
10:17 <vmassol> ...  
10:27 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <woshilapin> Oops, oops, oops, was not expecting this mess doing this ListBlock thing...  
10:33 <woshilapin> Sorry for it  
10:33 <tmortagne> woshilapin: me neither  
11:09 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <cjd> You know what would be really cool is if I type \*something\* in CKEditor, it converted that into italic automatically like autocorrect and \*\*bold\*\* same  
11:17 <cjd> Another cool feature would be if when closing the tab w/o saving, instead of a popup it just stored the HTML into localStorage and then when you open the same wiki/space/document/language, you see a little message just below the editor saying "You have unsaved work from <date/time>, restore it?"  
11:30 <vmassol> cjd: yes that would be nice to have this mode  
11:30 <vmassol> confluence has it  
11:30 <vmassol> btw we call it live helpers  
11:31 <cjd> Ahh ok  
11:31 <vmassol> that's one of our oldest issues  
11:31 <vmassol> raised by ludo 10 years ago...oops  
11:31 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-206  
11:31 <cjd> It might be possible to build this as a filter in the Realtime infrastructure  
11:36 <vmassol> we surely need this outside of realtime  
11:39 <cjd> But if realtime is not installed everywhere by default then we have failed our mission so I don't like the sound of that much :)  
11:41 <vmassol> I understand  
11:42 <vmassol> but it's not related to realtime  
11:42 <vmassol> we don't need to make realtile a turing machine ;)  
11:42 <vmassol> \*realtime  
11:42 <vmassol> turing complete  
11:42 <cjd> yeah  
11:43 <cjd> I'm trying to think whether external auto-replace of stuff will challenge our algorithm but I suppose it won't very much because CKEditor is already doing it w/ bold/italic/etc  
13:03 <lkrejci> has quit  
13:30 <MasterPiece> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <msmeria> has quit  
13:49 <MasterPiece> has quit  
14:02 <MasterPiece> has joined #xwiki  
14:09 <MasterPiece> has quit  
14:32 <cjd> has quit  
14:32 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <vmassol> guys what do you prefer when the XHTML parser fails to parse page content: 1) report an error about invalid content or 2) return an empty XDOM and just log a warning in the logs. I think I prefer 1)  
14:48 <cjd> hmm what makes it fail ?  
14:49 <vmassol> invalid xml for example  
14:49 <vmassol> we're talking about XHTML parser, not the HTML one which performs cleaning of input  
14:49 <cjd> var b = document.createElement('body'); b.innerHTML = badHTML; goodHTML = b.innerHTML    :D  
14:49 <cjd> I'd go for 1  
14:50 <vmassol> that would also be a solution btw, to also clean xhtml input as we do for the html parser but anwyay the question still stand in general  
14:50 <cjd> if we're posting the save and you give us back some kind of an ajax error, we'll cram the stuff through a cleaner and post again  
14:50 <vmassol> right now we generate an NPE when a parser fails to parse some content :)  
14:50 <cjd> yeah, would be nice if we get an error back in the ajax when saving  
14:51 <cjd> browsers can parse \*anything\*  
14:51 <vmassol> so that's another approach  
14:51 <vmassol> to prevent having invalid content in the first place  
14:51 <cjd> so innerHTML is aweful but it will convert kind of anything imaginable into valid HTML  
14:51 <vmassol> but it means degragded perf  
14:51 <vmassol> \*degraded  
14:51 <vmassol> since you need to parse the content to know if it's good or not  
14:52 <cjd> well if we're posting, we're going to post up innerHTML so if anything goes wrong, it would be best to throw an error which is clear enough that the user can see it and report a bug  
14:52 <vmassol> imagine using the REST api to set some content in a page for ex  
14:52 <cjd> because This Should Never Happen  
14:52 <cjd> yeah, IMO be loud  
14:52 <vmassol> oh it happens easily enough  
14:52 <vmassol> just type "hello" in xhtml content  
14:52 <cjd> :)  
14:52 <vmassol> this is invalid xhtml  
14:53 <vmassol> unless we run the html cleaner on it  
14:53 <vmassol> even for xhtml  
14:53 <cjd> Aaron has a hidden function for pushing garbage over the realtime socket to torture the other browser  
14:53 <vmassol> so slow down xhtml input  
14:53 <cjd> that reminds me of this  
14:53 <cjd> nah, skip HTML cleaner, throw an error  
14:53 <vmassol> yep  
14:53 <vmassol> becaue we can't gaurantee that no parser will ever generate an error anyway  
14:53 <vmassol> so we need to handle this anyway  
14:54 <cjd> give it back in REST/AJAX and let "us" handle it  
14:54 <vmassol> rest?  
14:54 <vmassol> there' sno rest/ajax  
14:54 <vmassol> this is rendering  
14:55 <cjd> oh ok, you mentioned "14:52 <@vmassol> imagine using the REST api"...  
14:55 <vmassol> that's when you said that we should check the input before saving  
14:55 <vmassol> I was mentioning this as an example that we shouldn't do that  
14:55 <vmassol> this = REST  
14:55 <ansuz> who's this Aaron guy  
14:55 <ansuz> he's taking credit for my work  
14:55 <vmassol> some astroturfer  
14:56 <cjd> I'd say if you're converting, convert and if something fails be loud, if you're just storing html then maybe you're not testing validity..  
15:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok with http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-440 ?  
15:26 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes, makes no sense to have any parser fail for empty content  
15:26 <vmassol> the trick is in the implementation ….  
15:27 <vmassol> I think I'll use a PushbackInputStream  
15:28 <vmassol> PushBackReader actually  
15:32 <vmassol> actually I'll do something simpler  
15:35 <tmortagne> you can check the String before parsing it no ?  
15:35 <vmassol> yes  
15:35 <vmassol> I'm doing this  
15:35 <vmassol> a bit less good but it's easier  
15:36 <vmassol> less good = it doesn't support all use cases but probably good neough  
15:36 <vmassol> \*enough  
15:36 <tmortagne> well the user case described in the issue is empty content :)  
15:36 <vmassol> what I mean is that we'd still be able to lookup the parser and call it  
15:36 <vmassol> and it'll still fail  
15:36 <vmassol> but at least document rendering will work  
15:36 <tmortagne> I meant test the String in the parser  
15:37 <tmortagne> the parser receive a String  
15:37 <vmassol> no  
15:37 <vmassol> only ContentParser  
15:37 <vmassol> after that it's a Reader  
15:37 <vmassol> DefaultContentParser does: getParser(syntax).parse(new StringReader(content));  
15:37 <vmassol> so I'm checking there  
15:38 <tmortagne> ok so it would fix the issue then  
15:39 <vmassol> indeed that won't fix XRENDERING-440  
15:39 <tmortagne> I forgot anout Reader  
15:39 <vmassol> for XRENDERING-440 I need a PushBackReader  
15:39 <vmassol> I'm still hesitating ;)  
15:40 <vmassol> if I fix XRENDERING-440 then I only fix one parser  
15:40 <tmortagne> maybe it's possible to configure the XML parser used so that it does not fail with empty content, or fail with specific exception  
15:40 <vmassol> I checked  
15:40 <vmassol> and couldn't find an option  
15:40 <vmassol> it fails with a SAXException  
15:41 <vmassol> actually a SAXParseException  
15:41 <vmassol> but that's too generic  
15:41 <tmortagne> i'm not a big fan of the "I don't know all the syntaxes but I'm sure nobody will ever do something with empty string" kind of fix, IMO it should be parser responsability  
15:41 <vmassol> so you think that empty content shouldn't always generate an empty XDOM?  
15:43 <tmortagne> I think only the parser knows  
15:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: there's another possibility which is also good I think  
15:44 <vmassol> which is to run the html cleaner also for xhtml input  
15:45 <vmassol> (this will make empty content be supported)  
15:45 <vmassol> it would make the xhtml parser less fragilr  
15:45 <vmassol> \*fragile  
15:45 <tmortagne> not sure about that, it makes the whole thing way slower for already valid content  
15:45 <vmassol> in prctice we don't use the xhtml parser  
15:45 <tmortagne> when you are not sure of your content you should use the html parser  
15:45 <vmassol> unless cleaner is turned off  
15:45 <vmassol> yes that was our logic  
15:46 <vmassol> but I see a lot of users complaining about the xhtml parser  
15:46 <vmassol> every time the issue is that the input is not valid xhtml  
15:46 <tmortagne> then they should use something else...  
15:47 <vmassol> for sure....  
15:47 <tmortagne> if it's not xhtml content then it does not work with xhtml parser, it's not like we were not provided another parser to take care of that  
15:47 <vmassol> yes  
15:59 <mflorea1> has quit  
16:08 <acotiuga> Hello! Raised http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13279. Was anyone aware about this and is it a bug?  
16:15 <Pbas> has quit  
16:16 <vmassol> acotiuga: I wasn't aware. marius might know more  
16:16 <acotiuga> I added a possible solution in the issue  
16:17 <acotiuga> hope it's ok  
16:25 <vmassol> tmortagne: are you going to revert the ListBLock change? It's a pain ATM for me and I can't merge changes  
16:26 <acotiuga> has quit  
16:26 <tmortagne> vmassol: did not really decided yet, I guess the best is to simply revert and keep the issue open, we can reapply it and modify if a good name is found  
16:28 <vmassol> sounds good to me  
16:29 <tmortagne> vmassol: can I let you do it ? I have lots of modif on platform right now  
16:30 <vmassol> ok but not now then I need to finish what I'm on first since I have lots of modifs in rendering ;)  
16:30 <tmortagne> ha right it's rendering, doing it  
16:44 <vmassol> thanks...  
16:44 <vmassol> now I need to clone again...  
16:44 <vmassol> and recreate my IDE project  
16:45 <vmassol> hmmm  
16:45 <vmassol> how do I commit my change  
16:45 <vmassol> :)  
16:45 <vmassol> I guess I'll need to copy my modified files in the new workspace...  
16:55 <woshilapin> has quit  
16:57 <tmortagne> why clone again ?  
17:04 <vmassol> what can I do?  
17:05 <vmassol> I cannot pull  
17:05 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
17:05 <vmassol> because I have local changes  
17:05 <vmassol> which I cannot get rid of  
17:05 <vmassol> because of the issue  
17:11 <tmortagne> vmassol: you should be able to fetch and them move to last commit cancelling the locl modifications  
17:12 <vmassol> it's too late now butI can fetch with local modifications?  
17:13 <vmassol> also note that I had a local commit as I mentioned  
17:13 <evalica> has quit  
17:13 <vmassol> anyway it's sorted out now  
17:14 <tmortagne> fetch don't touch you workspace so it does not care about local modification  
17:14 <tmortagne> it just update the commits  
17:15 <vmassol> indeed, maybe it would have worked to then do a git checkout on the gile  
17:15 <vmassol> \*file  
17:15 <vmassol> and then the merge  
17:16 <tmortagne> \* git reset --hard  
17:16 <tmortagne> s/test/tested/  
17:16 <vmassol> that would have lost my changes  
17:16 <vmassol> hence the checkout  
17:16 <tmortagne> (I tough git reset was staying on the same commit but it seems to move to the last one)  
17:17 <vmassol> anyway  
17:17 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
17:17 <evalica> has quit  
17:17 <tmortagne> you should have stashed them  
17:17 <vmassol> yes I could have uncommitted and stahed  
17:18 <vmassol> FYI I'm introducing a ErrorBlockGenerator component in rendering  
17:18 <vmassol> to replace MacroErrorManager  
17:19 <vmassol> so that I can use it in getXDOM()  
17:19 <vmassol> probably in org.xwiki.rendering.util

19:11 <vmassol> ansuz: hi  
19:11 <vmassol> I think there's sometihng amiss in your commits  
19:11 <vmassol> they don't find their way in the jira commit tab for the related issues  
19:12 <vmassol> are you sure you reference the jira issue in the commit message?  
19:13 <vmassol> ansuz: see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HRule:AlwaysputaJIRAissuereferenceincommitmessages  
19:16 <ansuz> that is entirely possible  
19:16 <vmassol> it would be good if you could follow this simple rule since it helps a lot finding code related to a jira issue later on  
19:17 <vmassol> I should have noticed earlier  
19:17 <vmassol> btw you should really read http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices fully  
19:17 <ansuz> I've copied down te URL for further reading on Monday  
19:17 <ansuz> I'm just about to head home  
19:17 <vmassol> because you're supposed to follow those practices ;)  
19:17 <vmassol> sure  
19:17 <vmassol> have a good we!  
19:17 <ansuz> toi aussi :)  
19:17 <vmassol> merci

19:53 <vmassol> but there are docs on xwiki.org  
19:53 <boubou> or a good tuto  
19:53 <boubou> ;(  
19:53 <vmassol> there are plenty of messags in the forum/ML about this
